data.title: Facebook will let employees work from home until July 2021
data.text: Facebook is extending its work from home policy until July of next year, becoming the latest tech giant to commit to letting staff work remotely in response to the coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: Jim Cramer: The Cramer Covid-19 stocks can still lead us higher
data.text: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer highlights market moves in a handful of tech stocks.

data.title: Facebook employees to work from home until July 2021 due to coronavirus outbreak; get $1,000 for home offices
data.text: Facebook Inc will allow employees to work from home until July 2021 due to the coronavirus outbreak and will give them $1,000 for home office needs, a spokeswoman for the social media giant said on Thursday.

data.title: Gene Munster breaks down Facebook's big day
data.text: Loup Ventures' Gene Munster talks about Facebook, which soared today. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman and Steve Grasso.

data.title: Facebook extends work from home option for employees until July 2021
data.text: Facebook, which operates a large engineering outpost in Seattle, said today that it will allow employees to work from home until July 2021 as COVID-19 continues to spread throughout the U.

data.title: Facebook will allow employees to work remotely until July 2021
data.text: Facebook will allow its employees to continue to work from home until July 2021, the company told CNBC on Thursday.

data.title: Facebook bans ads from a pro-Trump PAC
data.text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports Facebook will ban ads from a pro-Trump PAC for a period of time after the PAC repeatedly posted ads with inaccurate information.

data.title: How Parse Quarterlies On Amazon, Facebook And Microsoft
data.text: You’d think corporations like Amazon with a market capitalization far north of a trillion bucks would publish quarterly reports of more than bare-bones numbers with zero interpretive commentary.

data.title: 5 Top Stock Trades for Friday: UBER, FB, BMY, MU, TWLO
data.text: Bristol-Myers Squibb, Uber, Facebook, Micron and Twilio were our top stock trades for Friday. That said, let's look at the charts now.

data.title: Facebook Sends Nasdaq to New Record; Plug Power Looks to Tap Into EV Craze
data.text: Stock markets just keep going up.

data.title: Stock Market Today: 'FAAMNGs' Do the Market's Talking
data.text: The major indices closed higher for a fifth consecutive day on Thursday.

data.title: Facebook Shuts Down Romania-Linked Accounts Posing As Trump Supporters
data.text: Facebook has removed over 100 fake accounts based in Romania over suspected interference in the U. S. presidential election, the company said Thursday amid criticism that it has done too little to counter the spread of misinformation leading up to November.

data.title: Stephanie Link on FAANG stocks and markets
data.text: Stephanie Link, Hightower chief investment strategist, joins "Closing Bell" to discuss the current state of the markets.

data.title: Why Facebook Stock Jumped on Thursday
data.text: The social network's stock is getting some love following its launch of Instagram Reels.

data.title: Facebook rallies more than 5% following launch of its TikTok competitor
data.text: Shares of Facebook stock were up more than 5% on Thursday following the U.S. launch of Reels, a new Instagram feature designed to rival Chinese upstart TikTok.

data.title: Findings from Big Tech's private correspondence
data.text: The House Judiciary Committee released a selection of internal communications collected during its antitrust probe.
